content.description:
This question involves processing a  String  that represents a sequence of beads.

The  String  variable  beadSequence  represents a bead sequence. It contains a sequence of letters in which each letter represents the color of a bead.

A bead sequence is considered acceptable if it adheres to the following rules. Otherwise, it is not considered acceptable.

Rule 1: The number of beads in the sequence is between  5  and 10,  inclusive.

Rule 2: The sequence contains at least one blue bead (represented by  "B") and at least one white bead (represented by  "W"). 

Rule 3: The sequence starts and ends with the same color.

You will create three  boolean  variables to help determine whether the sequence is acceptable, and then print a message indicating the result. The following table illustrates the intended behavior for different values of  beadSequence.

Value of
beadSequence
Meets Rule 1
Meets Rule 2
Meets Rule 3
Printed Output
"OBWO"
false
true
true
"Not acceptable"
"BWBGOGWBB"
true
true
true
"Acceptable"
"ROYGBIVW"
true
true
false
"Not acceptable"
"BOBOBOBO"
true
false
false
"Not acceptable"
"WBWRWBWRWBWR"
false
true
false
"Not acceptable"
"BWWWBBWWWB"
true
true
true
"Acceptable"
content.question: Write a code segment that creates a  boolean  variable named  correctColors  and assigns it  true  if  beadSequence  meets rule 2 and assigns it  false  otherwise.

frqParts.text: Write a code segment that creates a  boolean  variable named  correctColors  and assigns it  true  if  beadSequence  meets rule 2 and assigns it  false  otherwise.

skill.text: 2.C: Write program code involving procedural abstractions.
